smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function show is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: mContext.getSystemService(Context.CONNECTIVITY_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to ConnectivityManager.
context cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
bool cannot be safely cast to Boolean.
mContext cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
activity.getSystemService(Activity.INPUT_METHOD_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to InputMethodManager.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: androidx.test.espresso.action.ViewActions.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
androidx.test.espresso.matcher.ViewMatchers.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
fr.jnda.ipcalc.ui.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.
This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: RedundantVisibilityModifierRule
smells.description: Checks for redundant visibility modifiers. Public is the default visibility for classes. The public modifier is redundant.

instances.message: mRuntimePermissionRule is explicitly marked as public. Properties are public by default so this modifier is redundant.
